channel.title: Hosting your private server on the internet? (freewebs,etc.)
channel.description: hi, i was wondering how i could host my private server on the internet? just like how you moparscape folks run your online (memory block) thing that connects to servers? i mean both are java so. what do i gotta do to host my server on the internet, rather then my own comp?

item.title: Hosting your private server on the internet? (freewebs,etc.)
item.dc:creator: @h_4_x_0_r h 4 x 0 r
item.description:
@h_4_x_0_r wrote:

No, you can’t.
You may purchase a VPS or a Dedicated server.
That’s probably where you got that idea from.

Read full topic
item.source: Hosting your private server on the internet? (freewebs,etc.)

item.title: Hosting your private server on the internet? (freewebs,etc.)
item.dc:creator: @pancholip pancholip
item.description:
@pancholip wrote:

they are both java though i understand one is a server and ones a webclient, but what do i gotta do to use lets say the freewebs server to host my server? you get what im saying?

Read full topic
item.source: Hosting your private server on the internet? (freewebs,etc.)

item.title: Hosting your private server on the internet? (freewebs,etc.)
item.dc:creator: @Itachi_Uchiha Itachi Uchiha
item.description:
@Itachi_Uchiha wrote:

if your talking servers then you have to run it off of your comp if you talking about a webclient you dont have to…but to connect other players to your server you have to use hamachi or portforwarding

Read full topic
